page.title: 05Education 2 - Llanarth Ct
page.content: Court House is the oldest building, it has a basement, 3 floors and an extension for the domestic staff. In the basement can be found the cellars changing rooms and showers and an adjoining refectory. Tunnels lead off from the cellars to the village church and Coach House but these have now been blocked off. 6 of the monks live in Court House. The ground floor houses a library, the headmaster's room and the 5th former's common room. The 5'th form sleep in the 9 dormitries on the 1st and 2nd floors supervised by the 6 monks. Other facilities include the linen room, wash room, games master's room, a tuck shop, book shop and a computer room. The monks have a choice of 8 bathrooms and have their own Benedictine chapel on the top floor.
